result.purpose: Responsible for HMAC (Hash-based Message Authentication Code) functionality, including signing and validation with support for configuration and clock skew management.
result.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating HMAC-related functionalities and tests within dedicated files, promoting separation of concerns and maintainability.

pkg/crypto/hmac/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for HMAC with normalization of whitelist addresses.

pkg/crypto/hmac/funcs.go.purpose: Provides HMAC signing functions using SHA256 and SHA512 algorithms.
side_effects: Modifies the order of parameters for signing
risks: Potential for timing attacks if not implemented securely
Improper handling of keys may lead to security vulnerabilities

pkg/crypto/hmac/funcs_test.go.purpose: Unit tests for HMAC signing functionality

pkg/crypto/hmac/hmac.go.purpose: Provides functionality for HMAC signature validation with clock skew allowance.
risks: Potential for time-based attacks if clock skew is not properly managed

pkg/crypto/hmac/hmac_test.go.purpose: Unit tests for HMAC validation functions, checking clock skew and signature validation.

pkg/crypto/hmac/init.go.purpose: This file initializes a singleton instance of the HMAC structure with a configuration.
side_effects: Initializes a global instance of HMAC
risks: Potential race conditions if InitInstance is called concurrently without proper synchronization
